description.narrative:
On 18 August the eastern embankment of the Kosi River in south-eastern Nepal collapsed resulting in major flooding in Nepal and in Bihar in north-east India. In Bihar 65,000 hectares of land has been inundated, over 4 million people from more than 2,300 villages have been affected across 16 districts in Bihar. About 315,600 homes have been destroyed and official Indian death toll as at 9 September stands at 87.
On 12 September 2008, the Foreign Minister announced that the Australian Government, through AusAID, will contribute AUD 1 million to flood relief efforts as follows: • AUD500,000 through World Food Program (WFP) for supply of ready-to-eat foods as well as nutritional food formula for infants and children up to two years of age; and • AUD500,000 through UNICEF to support to a broad range of interventions including medical relief, water and sanitation, child protection and education.
